result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C Chojnacki

defendant.name: Chojnacki, Joseph C
defendant.address: 9924 West Conrad Street, Hales Corners, WI 53130

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph C Chojnacki in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Joseph C Chojnacki.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 40, room 634 Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Joseph C Chojnacki in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph C Chojnacki in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant present but unable to connect with audio. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph C Chojnacki in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Deputy A. Kirkland. The Deputy is on an active scene unable to testify without background noise. Court ordered the case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Joseph C Chojnacki in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Joseph C Chojnacki in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph C Chojnacki appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
